frameDefinitions: Ambient conditions of temperature, precipitation, windiness, and sunniness pertain at a certain Place and Time.
These words describe the size of message that a Speaker is judged by a (usually unexpressed)
In this frame a Speaker ceases speaking, sometimes about a particular Topic.
An Agent produces a Forgery, an entity that they intend to pass off as a particular (instance of)  a Standard.
There is a gradable amount of light in a particular Location.
An Entity is judged by a sound Attribute of some perceived level of Volume intensity.
frameExamples: Graham is very shy with most people, but he gets very <t>chatty</t> with Mr. Roberts.
Finally, Jan <t>shut</t> <t>up</t> about his car accident.
So who was it that <t>faked</t> the photo 'showing' Jane Fonda and John Kerry with the Vietcong?
The small print was bearly readable by the light of the very <t>dim</t> torch.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the weather occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the weather occurs.
This is the person who is characterized as talkative, reticent etc.  It is usually the External Argument:

<fen>Text</fen> is rarely expressed because the quantity of information given is the focus of the frame, rather than the information content. Texts can occur as NP objects, but cannot be either direct quotes or complement clauses.
This role is the <fen>Topic</fen> on which much or little information is communicated. <fen>Topic</fen> is far more frequent than Message in this frame.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> has previously been speaking but has now stopped.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the <fen>Speaker</fen>'s voice or other communicative noise emitted by the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the becoming silent occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location where the becoming silent occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that creates a Forgery with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Forgery</fen> is the product that the <fen>Agent</fen> creates with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Standard</fen> is the actually existing or imagined (kind of) thing that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to pass the <fen>Forgery</fen> off as.
The time at which the forgery takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a <fen>Forgery</fen>.
The place whose amout of light is being described.  The <fen>Location</fen> can also be a location in time, as seen in the second example below:
The entity from which the light eminates.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the sound level <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under consideration. This role is incorporated in each LU in the frame.
A quantity or characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s sound output with repspect to its <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Volume</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Volume</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The place where an <fen>Entity</fen> is located.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> has been silent on this issue.
Kim is very talkative <fex>about her family and childhood</fex>.
She hid from the man in a dark <fex>corner</fex>.
A dim <fex>lamp</fex> swung over the entrance to the castle.
